node.title: Jury to decide if incident that left woman horribly burned was attempted murder or accident
node.alt: A close up of a jerry can and a woman in the background with her back to the camera.
node.description: After seven weeks of hearing evidence in the Hobart Supreme Court, the jury will now decide whether an incident in Hobart's north in 2017 — leaving a woman with severe burns to her body — was an attempted murder or an accident.
node.content:
["Deliberate act or accident? That is the question\u00a0a jury has been left to ponder.", "On April 24,\u00a02017, a\u00a0fight between a 39-year-old man and his 20-year-old girlfriend at a property in the Hobart suburb of Chigwell left the\u00a0woman with severe burns to more than half her body.", "The incident \u2014\u00a0the last in a\u00a0violent, broken relationship,\u00a0with abuse on both sides \u2014\u00a0has been examined in\u00a0a Supreme Court trial in Hobart during the past seven weeks.", "The prosecution claims it was\u00a0attempted murder, that the man allegedly poured petrol on his then-girlfriend and set her alight.\u00a0", "The man's lawyers\u00a0claim\u00a0the enraged woman shook the petrol on herself and later accidentally set herself on fire.", "The court heard the woman speak about how the man would control her \u2014 monitoring her movements by phone or tampering\u00a0with her car to stop her going anywhere.", "The man told the court that amongst the fighting there was a lot of love,\u00a0and marriage documents that were never finalised.", "", "
The Crown alleges that in April 2017 a man and a woman\u00a0entered a shed on a property at Chigwell,\u00a0and got into an argument.(ABC News: Richard Baines)
", "
Prosecution alleges man tried to 'frighten' partner into submission
", "In her closing statement, Deputy Director of Public Prosecutions Linda Mason SC told the jury the man would threaten to burn or kill the woman to control her, but that night it did not work \u2014 so he took it a step further.", "\"Ordinarily she would've backed down ... but this time she didn't.", "\"She was furious with him, so the accused had to take the next step.", "", "
Deputy Director of Public Prosecutions Linda Mason SC (right) told the jury the man would threaten to burn or kill the woman to control her.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "\"The pressure cooker situation reached a boiling point and he had to make good with the threat.", "\"It was swift, she was unprepared for it. It took her by surprise. It was not planned.\"", "Ms Mason told the jury the hardest part of their deliberations would be being satisfied beyond reasonable doubt that the man held the intention to kill the woman.\u00a0", "The court earlier heard he was the one who put the flames out and called for help.", "\"The moment he extended his arm and flicked that flame towards her was less than a second ... what state of mind coincided in that moment?\"", "She said the fact the man tried to help the woman afterwards was perhaps evidence of regret, but it did not absolve him.", "\"People can have moments of madness. Moments where they're capable of thinking and doing the most terrible things,\" Ms Mason\u00a0told the jury.", "\"That's just human nature. When the conditions are right and when you reach a point, it can make a person want to end the life of another.\u00a0", "\"The state say in that moment that is what occurred and you can be satisfied about that.\"", "
Defence asks jury to consider suicide attempt
", "Defence lawyer Greg Richardson began his closing arguments by asking the jury to \"leave emotion out of it\".", "He acknowledged that anyone would feel sympathy for the woman's injuries, but he told the jury they needed to assess the case on the facts.", "\"The evidence is overwhelming that [the woman] spilt fuel on herself,\" he said.", "\"[The man] might have been a controlling, aggressive person ... but he had no wish to cause her death.\"", "Mr Richardson told the jury the \"relationship evidence\" played throughout the trial was not indicative of what happened on April 24, but simply evidence of the nature of their relationship.", "", "
Defence lawyer Greg Richardson has asked the jury to \"leave emotion out of it\".(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "\"I'd suggest nobody meant it \u2026\u00a0threats to do all kinds of things. He'd assaulted her, she assaulted him. There was never any serious harm.\"\u00a0", "He drew on the fact the woman had a history of mental health issues and suicidal ideation, alleging that she had made two attempts on the day of the fire.", "\"[She made a] suicide attempt by pure coincidence on the same day \u2026\u00a0that he says she was threatening suicide,\" Mr Richardson said.", "\"[Before the fire, she was] a highly emotional young woman threatening suicide or at least making a gesture to make it look like she was threatening suicide.\"", "Mr Richardson told the jury he was not going to ask them to choose between the two versions \"because it's wrong\", but reminded them they needed to be convinced of the prosecution's case beyond reasonable doubt.", "The jury is expected to begin deliberating on Wednesday.\u00a0"]
